Class Maximize

All Implemented Interfaces:
MaxOperator
public class Maximize
extends Object
implements MaxOperator

Max-sum max operator that uses the max function.

Author:
Marc Pujol

For instance, the maximum operator would return the minimum operator.

compare

public int compare(double first,
                   double second)
Description copied from interface: MaxOperator
Compares two values, returning -1 if the first is worst, 0 if they are equal, or 1 if the first value is better.

Specified by:
compare in interface MaxOperator
Parameters:
first - first value to compare
second - second value to compare
Returns:
-1 if the first value is worst than the second, 0 if they are equal, or 1 otherwise.

getWorstValue

public double getWorstValue()
Description copied from interface: MaxOperator
Returns the worst possible value for this operator.

The returned value is one such that when operated with another value, the result is always the other value: operate(value, getWorstValue()) == value

Specified by:
getWorstValue in interface MaxOperator
Returns:
the worst possible value for this operator.
